page.title: 20RECREATION..SHOOTING
page.content: {Rough shooting}is popular along the hedgerows and in the woods. Rabbits, pigeons and pheasants are all shot, both as sport and, in the case of rabbits and pigeons, as pests. The rabbit has made a huge comeback since its population was desinated by Myxomatosis early in the 1950's. The rabbit causes most damage in Winter when it destroys fields of winter wheat. The pigeon also in recent times has become the enemy of farmers. Pigeons do great damage to oilseed rape, especially in winter, and attempts to control them are necessary. Pheasants are more often specifically introduced to provide sport for huntsmen who pay the land owner for the privilege of a day's shooting.
